thread.title: Security guard bludgeoned to death near MRR2
thread.title_full: Security guard bludgeoned to death near MRR2

author: NATASHA JOIBI
title: Security guard bludgeoned to death near MRR2
text:
Thursday, 23 February 2017 | MYT 9:17 AM Security guard bludgeoned to death near MRR2 by natasha joibi MRR2. 
KUALA LUMPUR: A security guard died 16 hours after he was allegedly bludgeoned with a bottle and helmet near the Middle Ring Road 2 (MRR2) here. 
The 40-year-old guard shattered his jawbone and suffered cuts to his face in the brutal attack which occurred at about 4am Monday. 
Sentul OCPD Asst Comm R. Munusamy said the victim was drenched in blood when he was sent home by an acquaintance at around 5am. 
His 37-year-old wife was shocked to see her husband, who had lost all ability to speak, returning from his night shift in a bloodied state. 
He was sent to Hospital Kuala Lumpur for treatment, but was pronounced dead at approximately 9.25pm the same day. 
ACP Munusamy said police opened a murder investigation following the incident, and tracked down the acquaintance who sent him home. 
"We located his friend and arrested him near the Intan Baiduri People's Housing Project (PPR) on Tuesday. 
"He is now in police custody to facilitate investigations. 
"We arrested another man who could have also been involved in the incident on Wednesday,," he explained. 
ACP Munusamy said an incident had broken out near a petrol station along the MRR2 which led to the assault at around 4am Monday. 
"The victim was struck with blunt objects believed to be a helmet and bottle. 
"We are still investigating the possible motives behind the assault," he added.
